alert.note: Alert for Central and South Weld County; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 1:29PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Arapahoe, eastern Denver and western Adams Counties through 200 PM MDT... At 129 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout tornado along a line extending from near Brighton to Aurora, or along a line extending from 29 miles south of Greeley to 7 miles southeast of Denver. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts possible and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Locations impacted include... Eastern Denver, Aurora, northeastern Commerce City, Brighton, Denver International Airport, D.I.A Terminal and Concourses, Lochbuie, Hudson, Buckley SFB, Barr Lake and Todd Creek. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If a tornado is spotted seek shelter inside a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central and South Weld County; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County
